definition: Explotation of children through work that deprives them of their childhood and dignity.
prevalence: Approximately 138 million children in child labour, 2024.
hazardous_work: 79 million children in hazardous work in 2020, which includes mining, heavy machinery and dangerous chemicals.
causes: Poverty, lack of educational access, and debt are major drivers of child labour.
sectors: Agriculture sector employing about 70% of child labourers. Other sectors include fx mining and textile industry.
regional_Distribution: Sub-Saharan Africa, highest incidence of child labour. Asia and the Pacific, largest absolute numbers.
international_efforts: Unicef and International Labour Organization (ILO) made Conventions 138 and 182 for aiming to eliminate child labour.
Future: According to Unicef, in 2045 the current pace of progress will require 7 times the current pace in 2024 to eliminate child labor.
